case_vignette: A 20-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a circular hypopigmented lesion on her right cheek. The patient stated that she used to have a mole in the same location. Over time she noticed a white area around the mole that enlarged to the current size of the lesion. After a few months she noticed the mole in the center of the lesion had disappeared. On further questioning, she denies any personal or family history of skin cancer.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a round, lighter patch on my skin on my right cheek where I used to have a mole.
How old are you?
I'm 20 years old.
Do you have any family history of skin conditions?
No, I don't have any family history of skin conditions.
Have you had any recent sun exposure in that area?
You didn't provide information about recent sun exposure, so I can't provide that detail.
Got it. Do you have any other new moles or changes in existing moles? And have you noticed any changes in the border, color, or size of the patch on your right cheek?
No, I haven't noticed any new moles or changes in existing ones, and the patch on my cheek hasn't changed recently.
Have you been taking any medications, including over-the-counter or herbal supplements?
You haven't mentioned any use of medications or supplements, so I can't provide that information.
Understood. Have you ever had any biopsies or surgeries done on your skin in the past?
No, I haven't had any biopsies or surgeries on my skin.
**Final Diagnosis:** Post-Inflammatory Hypopigmentation
